columns.id: The unique identifier for each artist.
columns.name: The name of the artist.

artists.table_description: The table maintains a catalog of music artists.

columns.id: The unique identifier for each album.
columns.title: The title of the album.
columns.artist_id: The identifier of the artist associated with the album.

albums.table_description: The table catalogs various music albums by different artists.

columns.id: The unique identifier for each employee.
columns.last_name: The last name of the employee.
columns.first_name: The first name of the employee.
columns.title: The job title of the employee.
columns.reports_to: The identifier of the employee's manager.
columns.birth_date: The birth date of the employee.
columns.hire_date: The date the employee was hired.
columns.address: The residential address of the employee.
columns.city: The city where the employee resides.
columns.state: The state where the employee resides.
columns.country: The country where the employee resides.
columns.postal_code: The postal code of the employee's address.
columns.phone: The contact phone number of the employee.
columns.fax: The fax number of the employee.
columns.email: The email address of the employee.

employees.table_description: The table stores employee details for the store.

columns.id: The unique identifier for each customer.
columns.first_name: The first name of the customer.
columns.last_name: The last name of the customer.
columns.company: The company name associated with the customer.
columns.address: The residential address of the customer.
columns.city: The city where the customer resides.
columns.state: The state where the customer resides.
columns.country: The country where the customer resides.
columns.postal_code: The postal code of the customer's address.
columns.phone: The contact phone number of the customer.
columns.fax: The fax number of the customer.
columns.email: The email address of the customer.
columns.support_rep_id: The identifier of the customer's support representative.

customers.table_description: The table maintains customer details within the store.

columns.id: The unique identifier for each invoice line.
columns.invoice_id: The identifier of the associated invoice.
columns.track_id: The identifier of the track being purchased.
columns.unit_price: The price per unit of the track.

invoice_lines.table_description: The table records details of each line in invoices.

columns.id: The unique identifier for each genre.
columns.name: The name of the music genre.

genres.table_description: The table lists various music genres available in the store.

columns.id: The unique identifier for each invoice.
columns.customer_id: The identifier of the associated customer.
columns.invoice_date: The date when the invoice was generated.
columns.billing_address: The billing address of the customer.
columns.billing_city: The city of the customer's billing address.
columns.billing_state: The state of the customer's billing address.
columns.billing_country: The country of the customer's billing address.
columns.billing_postal_code: The postal code of the customer's billing address.
columns.total: The total amount charged in the invoice.

invoices.table_description: The table records details of customer invoices within the store.

columns.id: The unique identifier for each media type.
columns.name: The name of the media type.

media_types.table_description: The table classifies different types of media available in the store.

columns.id: The unique identifier for each track.
columns.name: The title of the music track.
columns.album_id: The identifier of the album containing the track.
columns.media_type_id: The identifier of the media type for the track.
columns.genre_id: The identifier of the genre to which the track belongs.
columns.composer: The name of the composer of the track.
columns.milliseconds: The duration of the track in milliseconds.
columns.bytes: The size of the track file in bytes.
columns.unit_price: The price charged for the track.

tracks.table_description: The table holds details about music tracks in the store.

columns.id: The unique identifier for each playlist.
columns.name: The name of the playlist.

playlists.table_description: The table maintains different playlists within the store.

columns.playlist_id: The unique identifier of the associated playlist.
columns.track_id: The unique identifier of the associated track.

playlist_tracks.table_description: The table links tracks to their respective playlists in the store.
